title: Expand Training Data for Complex Query Patterns
summary: This PR focuses on expanding the training dataset to include more complex query patterns. The goal is to enhance the natural language understanding capabilities of shAIX by incorporating diverse and intricate query examples.

review_states.comment: The variety of complex query patterns looks good and should definitely help with the model's understanding. However, the data isn't fully integrated into the existing training pipeline. Some scripts might need updates to accommodate the new data format.
The new patterns are impressive, but the unit tests haven't been updated to reflect these changes. We need to ensure that our tests cover these new scenarios to maintain robustness.

title: Implement Session Data Structure for Context Awareness
summary: Introduce a new data structure to store session data, including user ID and session timestamp, to maintain context for AI search queries.

review_states.comment: The new data structure looks solid and meets the criteria. Fields for both user ID and session timestamp are included. Nice work! LGTM, approved! üéâ
The data structure is well-defined, and the unit tests are comprehensive, covering storing and retrieving session data effectively. Great job! LGTM! Approved! üöÄ

title: Enhance Error Handling for Third-Party Integration
summary: Implement robust error handling mechanisms to improve the resilience of shAIX when integrating with third-party applications. This includes adding specific error messages, retry logic, and fallback procedures.

review_states.comment: The retry logic looks solid, and I appreciate the detailed comments. The integration tests also show a clear improvement in resilience. Great job! LGTM, approved!
The code adheres to our standards, and the fallback procedures are well thought out. Everything looks good to me. LGTM, approved!

title: Enhance Search Bar UI for Intuitiveness
summary: This PR focuses on redesigning the search bar to make it more intuitive for users. It includes changes to the layout, color scheme, and iconography based on recent user feedback.

review_states.comment: The layout changes look great and match the new design specs perfectly. The user feedback from initial testing is really positive. LGTM, approved! üéâ

title: Create Database Table for Session Data Storage
summary: Set up a new database table to store session data, indexed by user ID and session timestamp, to facilitate quick retrieval of context information.

review_states.comment: The table structure looks good, but the migration script needs to include the index creation for the session timestamp to ensure optimal query performance.
I agree with the need for indexing the session timestamp for performance. Everything else looks solid.

Agreed with the need to address the AppX issue. Let us know if you need help with debugging. Looking forward to the updates!

title: Redesign Filter Options for Enhanced Usability
summary: This PR involves updating the filter options to be more user-friendly and accessible, making it easier for users to refine their search results.

review_states.comment: The labels are clearer, which is great! However, the placement of the 'Apply' button is a bit confusing. Please consider revising its position.
The labels are more intuitive, but the 'Reset Filters' option isn't retaining its previous functionality and seems to be clearing more than it should. Please address this issue.

title: Update NLP API to Support Hybrid Model Approach
summary: This PR updates the existing NLP API to handle more complex queries using a hybrid model approach that combines rule-based and machine learning techniques. The update aims to enhance the flexibility and accuracy of query processing.

review_states.comment: The integration of rule-based and ML components looks solid. However, the API documentation needs to be updated to reflect the new capabilities and usage guidelines.
The code changes are impressive, but the documentation needs to be more comprehensive. Additionally, there's an issue with nested queries failing in the integration tests that needs to be addressed.

title: Develop API for Session Data Management
summary: Implement an API to manage session data, allowing for the creation, retrieval, and deletion of session information as needed for context-aware search.

review_states.comment: The endpoints for creating, retrieving, and deleting session data look solid. Great job on that! However, the API documentation is a bit sparse. It would be helpful to have more detailed examples for each endpoint, especially for new team members.

The endpoints are well-structured, but the input validation could be tightened up. Consider handling unexpected data types, overly large payloads, and ensuring all required fields are checked before processing.

title: Test Integration Scenarios with Third-Party Applications

title: Implement Session Data Cleanup Mechanism
summary: Introduce a mechanism to periodically clean up expired or unused session data to maintain database efficiency and manage storage costs.

Great work on the cleanup mechanism and documentation. I recommend adding more test scenarios to ensure active session data isn't affected, especially for edge cases. Also, consider making the cleanup frequency configurable.
